Sentence Rearrangement: 
S1: The machines are usually controlled by a keyboard. 
S6: Thus, errors are minimized. 
P: The operator types the instructions. 
Q: These instructions are stored in the memory. 
R: The computer then executes the instructions. 
S: They are displayed on the screen.

Sentence Rearrangement: 
S1: Ants are the most interesting of all insects. 
S6: They also have a highly developed social life. 
P: They are found in almost all parts of the world. 
Q: Some of them build anthills. 
R: These are often several feet high. 
S: They are very hardworking.

Statement: 'If you want to get good marks in mathematics, practice hard.' 
Assumption I: Mathematics is a difficult subject. 
Assumption II: Practice helps in getting good marks.
options: Both I and II are implicit
Neither I nor II is implicit

questions.question:
Statement: 'The government has decided to ban the sale of tobacco in the state.' 
Argument I: Yes, it causes cancer and is harmful to health. 
Argument II: No, it will lead to unemployment for those working in the tobacco industry.
options: Both I and II are strong
Neither I nor II is strong
questions.answer: Both I and II are strong

Read the passage and answer: 'The school has always been the most important means of transferring the wealth of tradition from one generation to the next. This applies today in an even higher degree than in former times, for through modern development of the economic life, the family as bearer of tradition and education has become weakened.' 

What is the main idea?
options: Schools have an increased responsibility in transmitting tradition.
questions.answer: Schools have an increased responsibility in transmitting tradition.

questions.question:
Reading Comprehension: 'There is a shift in our economy from a manufacturing to a service orientation. The increase in service-sector will require the managers to reflect new emphasis on the human element.' 

Which of the following can be inferred?
options: Service sector requires more physical labor.
Interpersonal skills will become more important for managers.
questions.answer: Interpersonal skills will become more important for managers.

questions.question:
Statement: 'A large number of people in the city are diagnosed with malaria.' 

Course of Action I: The city municipal authorities should take immediate steps to carry out fumigation. 
Course of Action II: The people in the area should be advised to use mosquito repellents.

Statement: 'Severe drought has been reported in many parts of the country.' 

Course of Action I: The government should immediately make arrangements for providing financial assistance to those affected. 
Course of Action II: Food, water, and fodder should be immediately sent to these areas to save people and cattle.

Cause & Effect: 
Statement A: The prices of petrol and diesel have increased significantly. 
Statement B: The transport companies have increased their fares.
options: Statement A is the cause and B is the effect
Statement B is the cause and A is the effect
Both are effects of independent causes
questions.answer: Statement A is the cause and B is the effect

questions.question:
Cause & Effect: 
Statement A: There was a huge rush of people to the temple last Sunday. 
Statement B: The police authority had tightened the security around the temple last Sunday.
options: Statement A is the cause and B is the effect
Statement B is the cause and A is the effect
Both are effects of a common cause
questions.answer: Statement A is the cause and B is the effect
